column1: “When this matter was resumed on 14.07.2005 learned State Counsel
for  the  respondents  informed  Court  that  he  could  not  obtain  the
required  information  from  the  Ministry  of  Education  as  the  said
information is not available with them. In the circumstances we have taken
petitioners in relation to the percentages based on religion at the time the school
was vested in the government. Accordingly, in terms of the extracts of proceedings
of the Methodist Church Synod held at Scott Hall, Colpetty in January 1961, out of
the total of 760 students, there had been 53 Christian. Therefore the percentage of
Christians at Southlands as at 1961 was not 2% as claimed by the respondents, but
6.9% as stated by the petitioners”. [End of Quotation]
